Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for real-time messaging, scalability, and latency. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Web PubSub.
Design the architecture for integrating Azure Web PubSub with the web application, including client-server communication, message routing, and failover mechanisms.
Provision the Azure Web PubSub service in the Azure portal, specifying the region and resource group.
Set up authentication mechanisms, such as Azure Active Directory or shared access keys, to secure connections to the Web PubSub service.
Implement the client-side application to connect to Azure Web PubSub using supported SDKs or REST APIs.
Develop server-side logic to handle incoming messages, broadcast updates, and manage connections using Azure Web PubSub SDKs.
Set up message routing rules to ensure proper delivery of messages to specific clients or groups.
Enable encryption for data in transit and at rest. Configure firewall rules and access control policies to secure the Web PubSub service.
Perform testing to validate real-time messaging, latency, and failover scenarios. Ensure the service meets performance requirements.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor to track connection status, message delivery, and performance metrics.
Create detailed documentation for the architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share with the operations team for future reference.
Ensure the setup complies with organizational and regulatory requirements. Conduct regular audits to verify compliance and security postures.
